# Pull Request Checklist

**Before submitting your Pull Request, please review the following:**

## 1. Code Quality & Standards

*   [ ] My code adheres to the **Apex Technical Authority** standards and the December 2025 edition of the `AGENTS.md` directives.
*   [ ] The code is well-commented where necessary, especially for complex logic.
*   [ ] I have followed the established **Apex Tech Stack** for Python: uv, Ruff, Pytest.
*   [ ] My code follows the **Modular Monolith** architectural pattern.
*   [ ] I have minimized the use of `print` statements and will use proper logging mechanisms.
*   [ ] All new code has been linted and formatted using **Ruff**.

## 2. Testing

*   [ ] All new features have corresponding unit tests written using **Pytest**.
*   [ ] Existing tests have been run and all pass.
*   [ ] The test coverage has not decreased.
*   [ ] Integration tests (if applicable) have been considered and passed.

## 3. Documentation

*   [ ] I have updated the **README.md** to reflect changes, if necessary.
*   [ ] I have updated any relevant internal documentation (e.g., architectural diagrams, API descriptions) if applicable.
*   [ ] I have reviewed the **AGENTS.md** file and ensured my changes align with its directives.

## 4. Commit History

*   [ ] My commit history is clean and meaningful (e.g., no "WIP" commits, logical commit messages).
*   [ ] I have rebased my branch onto the latest main branch to avoid merge conflicts.

## 5. Security

*   [ ] I have considered potential security implications of my changes.
*   [ ] I have not introduced any new dependencies that are not thoroughly vetted.

## Description of Changes

*Please provide a clear and concise summary of the changes made in this pull request.*

<summary>Details</summary>

*   *What problem does this PR solve?*
*   *What changes were made to address the problem?*
*   *How can this be tested?*
*   *Are there any breaking changes?*

</details>
